commentBody: Such decisions reveal that the passion of fans don't matter a whit, and makes all the more repugnant and sad the ability of the NFL to gin up our tribal sensibilities through the fanfare and the glamour of Sunday games (or Thursday or Monday games as well I suppose).  The increasing prominence of the part of the NFL that is "just business" (pitting cities against each other to extract optimal stadium deals, disregard for players' short term and long term health, free agency, salary caps, etc.) exposes an absurdist landscape.  That this happened against a backdrop where it is common to rail against the 1% or "the elite" makes this action all the richer.
